senses.sense_definition: An award presented annually by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences to recognize excellence in the film industry; also refers to the golden statuette given to winners.

examples.text: Every actor dreams that one day they will win an <w>Oscar</w>.
The director placed his <w>Oscar</w> on the shelf next to his other trophies.

senses.sense_definition: A large predatory freshwater fish native to South America, often kept in aquariums.

examples.text: We need a larger tank because our <w>oscar</w> has grown very quickly.
The <w>oscar</w> is known for being an intelligent and sometimes aggressive fish.

senses.sense_definition: The code word representing the letter O in the NATO phonetic alphabet.

examples.text: Please spell your name using the phonetic alphabet, saying <w>Oscar</w> for O.
The pilot confirmed the coordinates using <w>Oscar</w> to avoid confusion.
He did not have enough <w>oscar</w> in his pocket to pay for the drinks.
I need to stop at the bank to get some <w>oscar</w> before we go out.
My brother <w>Oscar</w> is coming to visit us next week.
They decided to name their new baby <w>Oscar</w> after his grandfather.

senses.sense_definition: An acronym for Orbiting Satellite Carrying Amateur Radio.

examples.text: The amateur radio operators tracked the signal from the <w>OSCAR</w> satellite.
Building an <w>OSCAR</w> requires cooperation between engineering teams and hobbyists.
